caseTitle: DEVELOPMENT OF CUSTOMARY LAW [1991-92] VOL. XVIII RGL 68—94
summary: This decision from the Supreme Court of Ghana addresses the development and interpretation of customary law within the national legal system. It examines how customary law evolves and is applied by the judiciary, emphasizing the court's role in shaping and refining customary legal principles in line with contemporary justice and legal coherence. The case is part of a broader jurisprudential effort to integrate and modernize customary law within Ghana's legal framework.
verdict: The court affirmed the dynamic nature of customary law and its development through judicial interpretation.
rationaleHighlights: Interpretation and evolution of customary law principles
Role of courts in developing customary law
confidenceNotes: Source text is truncated; analysis based on available metadata and standard citation format for Ghanaian legal reports.
